FuncDef:
The storm suppression command configures the maximum volume of broadcast, unknown multicast, or unknown unicast packets that can pass through a BD.
The undo storm suppression command cancels the configuration. The storm suppression command configures the maximum volume of broadcast, unknown multicast, or unknown unicast packets that can pass through a BD. The undo storm suppression command cancels the configuration. By default, the rate of broadcast, unknown multicast, or unknown unicast traffic is not limited in a BD. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: storm suppression { broadcast | multicast | unknown-unicast } cir <cir-value> [ gbps | kbps | mbps ] [ cbs <cbs-value> [ bytes | kbytes | mbytes ] ]
undo storm suppression { broadcast | multicast | unknown-unicast }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the committed information rate (CIR), which is the allowed rate at which traffic can pass through.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 kbit/s to 4294967295 kbit/s.

Specifies the CIR in the unit of Gbit/s.
-

Specifies the CIR in the unit of kbit/s.
-

Specifies the CIR in the unit of Mbit/s.
-

Specifies the committed burst size (CBS), which is the committed volume of traffic that can pass through.
The value is an integer that ranges from 10000 bytes to 4294967295 bytes.

Specifies the CBS in the unit of bytes.
-

Specifies the CBS in the unit of kbytes.
-

Specifies the CBS in the unit of Mbytes.
